SEARCH
Package prelim

Class CustomFile

java.lang.Object
prelim.CustomFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<CustomFile>
public class CustomFile extends Object implements Comparable<CustomFile>
The CustomFile class represents a file with attributes such as the file name, file extension, size, creation date, last modification date, content, existence status, and file path. It supports operations like reading content from an existing file, creating new files, and deleting files.

    • CustomFile

      public CustomFile(String filePath) throws Exception
      Constructs a CustomFile object from an existing file on disk.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the existing file.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the file is not found or is invalid.

    • CustomFile

      public CustomFile(String fileName, String extension, String content) throws IOException
      Constructs a new CustomFile and writes the specified content to it.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the new file.
      extension - The extension of the new file (e.g., ".txt").
      content - The content to write to the new file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue creating or writing to the file.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(CustomFile otherFile)
      Compares two CustomFile objects based on their file names.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<CustomFile>
      Parameters:
      otherFile - The other CustomFile to compare.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this file name is less than, equal to, or greater than the other file name.

    • toString
